‚ö´Ô∏è Respecting Others
‚ö´Ô∏è Always Safe
‚ö´Ô∏è Be Responsible

The first quarter assembly targeted positive sportsmanship and encouragement of others in a scooter race event. The students in the audience then had the opportunity to exhibit positive sportsmanship and encouragement toward their peers.

After the assembly, each class had a chance to participate in a smaller scooter race to ensure all students the opportunity to celebrate behavioral successes, set goals, and have fun!

Recently the Human Body Systems class at ADM High School attended a hands-on workshop at Des Moines University called "Get Your Foot in the Door." Students learned about the ins and outs of podiatric medicine from DMU students.

The day consisted of hands-on activities where students got to learn about and practice tasks that a podiatrist would do on a day to day basis. Students got to practice sutures on pig feet, use ultrasound machines, cast their feet as they would when fitting a patient for orthotics, and practice the process of sterilizing and gowning for surgery. It was a day filled with fun and learning and left students with some ideas about potential future medical careers.

ADM School Board Election Results - ADM Community School District
text:
ADM School Board elections took place November 5, 2019. The unofficial results indicate that Bart Banwart (incumbent), Tim Canney (Incumbent), Heith Hockenberry, and Nikki West were elected to the ADM School Board. They join remaining board member Rod Collins to form the new ADM School Board.

Thank you to all that participated in this election and your continued support of ADM Schools.
